bapjeongne.name: Bapjeongne
bapjeongne.tagline: Your personal lunch curator that solves the daily food dilemma
bapjeongne.description: Bapjeongne quiets the mental whirlwind of "What should I eat today?" and cleanly recommends one restaurant nearby. Tap your location on the map, and it scans all restaurants within your radius, presenting a single choice with a short countdown. The decision process stays light; the meal stays satisfying.

0.title: Location-Based Smart Restaurant Picks
0.description: Select your location on the map, and it quickly finds restaurants within your set radius (500m–3000m). The moment the countdown ends, today's lunch candidate appears on screen.

1.title: Intuitive Map View
1.description: Recommended restaurants can be verified on the map instantly. Your current location and the restaurant are displayed together, solving navigation at a glance.

2.title: Visit Statistics That Record Your Choices
2.description: Automatically organizes the number of restaurants visited in a month, revisit rates, and more. Frequented spots and new discoveries become small, solid data points that reveal your dining preferences.

0.title: 1. Select Location & Set Search Radius
0.description: Choose your location on the map and set your desired radius (500m–3000m).

1.title: 2. 3-Second Countdown → Random Pick
1.description: With a short countdown, the app cleanly recommends one restaurant within your radius.

2.title: 3. View Restaurant Info & Visit Stats
2.description: Check the recommended restaurant's info and verify its location on the map. Review your visit statistics too.

1.caption: Intuitively adjust budget, atmosphere, and distance filters.

2.caption: Share recommendation results via link for group voting.

3.caption: Explore the various features of the Bapjeongne app.

0.question: Where does the restaurant data come from?
0.answer: We combine Kakao/Naver place data with our own curated restaurant database.

1.question: Can I see only restaurants I've added?
1.answer: You can create a personal favorites list and choose to only randomize from your list.

2.question: Are there ads?
2.answer: In-app ads are minimized, and there is no paid placement in the recommendation list.

summary.problem: Lunch menu decision stress, the monotony of always going to the same place, moments when browsing for new restaurants feels tiresome, times when you need someone to choose for you.
summary.solution: Designed with the goal of "making one person's day a little lighter" rather than heavy features. From the moment you tap the map to the moment a recommendation arrives, a small rhythm and playful UI flows through. Making that one daily choice simpler and more enjoyable.

intro.title: Meet Bapjeongne
intro.flowTitle: A Light but Seamless User Flow

intro.flowDesc2: A smart app that's easy to use—that's the core of Bapjeongne.

The app never overpromises—it quietly works like a polite housekeeper for your favorite menus.

0.question: Can I manage multiple babies?
0.answer: Yes, you can register multiple babies and manage independent medication records and reminders for each.

1.question: How many reminders can I set?
1.answer: You can set up to 3 medication time reminders per baby per day, with day-of-week repeat options.

2.question: Where is the data stored?
2.answer: All data is stored locally on the device and is not transmitted to external servers. Cloud backup is planned for future updates.

3.question: Can I add past medication records?
3.answer: Yes, you can set the date and time to a past date to correct previous records.

4.question: Do reminders work when the app is closed?
4.answer: Yes, local push notifications are used, so reminders are sent at the set time even when the app is closed.

summary.problem: When giving medicine to babies, parents rely on memory like "Did I give it last night?" making it difficult to prevent duplicate doses or missed doses. Also, it was hard to accurately communicate "when, what, and how much" during hospital visits.
summary.solution: Designed to minimize memory dependence and enable record-based medication management. Adding a record is simplified to complete in 10 seconds, and month/week/day calendar views let you overview medication status at a glance. Up to 3 smart reminders per day help ensure no dose is missed.

senior-care-diary.name: Senior Med Diary
senior-care-diary.tagline: Register once, auto-manage for the period
senior-care-diary.description: A mobile app that helps you register medications for seniors in advance and easily check daily compliance. Set a medication period and the schedule is shown automatically for that period—caregivers only need to check off each dose.

0.title: Register Once, Auto-Manage for the Period
0.description: Register medication once and it appears automatically every day for the medication period. No need to enter daily—just check off.

1.title: Simple Compliance Check
1.description: Record with checkboxes by time (morning, lunch, evening). See at a glance whether each dose was taken.

2.title: Month/Week/Day Medication Log
2.description: View compliance at a glance on the calendar. Tap a date to see that day's detailed medication history.

3.title: Manage Multiple Seniors
3.description: Manage both parents or in-laws in one app. Each senior has a separate list of current medications.

0.title: 1. Register Senior Profile
0.description: Enter name, gender, and optional notes (chronic meds, allergies). Manage multiple seniors.

1.title: 2. Register Medication
1.description: Set medication name, period (start–end), and up to 5 daily times. The app shows it automatically every day for that period.

2.title: 3. Check Off on Today Screen
2.description: Today's medication list is shown in time order. One tap on the checkbox records completion.

3.title: 4. Log & Reminders to Prevent Misses
3.description: Review compliance on the calendar and get push reminders at medication times so you never miss a dose.

0.question: Can I manage multiple seniors?
0.answer: Yes, you can register multiple seniors and manage separate medication lists and history for each.

1.question: How many reminders can I set?
1.answer: Up to 5 medication time reminders per senior per day. They are created automatically when you register a medication.

2.question: Where is the data stored?
2.answer: All data is stored only on your device. The first version does not send data to any external server.

3.question: Can I check off past dates?
3.answer: Yes. If you forgot to check, you can open the calendar, select a past date, and record the dose later.

summary.problem: When seniors take multiple medications, caregivers rely on memory like "Did they take the morning pill?" and it's hard to manage who took what when caring for several people.
summary.solution: Designed so that once you register a medication, it appears automatically every day for the period. Caregivers only record compliance with a single checkbox, and the calendar and reminders help prevent missed doses.
